other_tests.findings: Two masses detected: a larger mass (3.8 by 2.8 cm) originating from the chordae tendineae attached to the anterolateral papillary muscle, and a smaller mass (2.5 by 2.5 cm) attached to the interatrial septum near the base of the anterior leaflet of the mitral valve. Both masses were mobile, globular, and pedunculated.

Left ventricular and left atrial masses were nonhomogeneous, mobile, and globular. Normal size of both left and right heart chambers, with normal left and right ventricular systolic function. No pericardial effusion and only trace mitral insufficiency observed.
Histological examination showed paucicellular myxomatous tissue containing lepidic cells, fibrin, degeneration, and fibrosis, along with a typical capillary network for myxomas.
Confirmed based on elevated levels of plasma adrenocorticotropic hormone, serum cortisol, and other hormonal tests.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Clinical and biochemical remission of Cushing's syndrome sustained for 1.9 years without medication.
